Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @stefjazar after spending some time experimenting with beam (mimblewimble) found out it is an interactive protocol and not noninteractive. basically it is like barterdex where both sender and receiver need to be online at the same time, for every transaction. seems not very practical. maybe grin is noninteractive, not sure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the beam devs seem to be saying mimblewimble is an interactive protocol and as such it seems unlikely to gain mass acceptance

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the latter is my conjecture

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://github.com/BeamMW/beam/issues/235

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it seems this widely anticipated protocol has some significant downside that few other crypto coins have.

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: so is the assumption that  nodes are always up?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am working with them to hopefully improve things

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the MW protocol requires sender and receiver to both be involved. initial implementation uses a direct connection, but I hope the tx can be split into two halfs to gain noninteractiveness

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no idea about grin implementation, just been fiddling with beam as it is in C++

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can cancel a tx that didnt complete, so it isnt any loss of funds issues, just works in a way very different than other crypto so some additional work is needed. for v1 release i think just a working implementation is a great achievement

Author: crumb#2550
Content:
please correct me if i'm wrong here jl777, but my understanding of supernet asset is that all the different elements of the ecosystem like CRYPTO, DEX, JUMBLR, PANGEA etc will start to produce revenues with ever increasing volumes.

is is just way too early to expect to see this. yes, the lack of liquidity can be/ is an issue for some people, but the intrinsic value of SUPERNET does not increase with more back-and-forth trading of the SUPERNET asset, but with the adoption of the underlying projects that SUPERNET own.

this reminds me of a saying of Warren Buffett: "I try to invest in such companies that even when the markets will be turned off for 10 years, i will still be confident that my investments are doing just fine" more liquidity is always good, but there is just too much emphasis on short term speculation.

SUPERNET is not an instrument for short term speculation, but a long term view on whole blockchain ecosystem. i suggest NOT to dismantle it. people just have to understand what they invest in.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: thanks. i guess if there are more people that feel this way and can help with developing the other assetchains, then it wont all be up to me

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: i would also agree that SUPERNET is not for short-term. hodl is the way since the SuperNET ico
